intro: Nasa weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and opposite leaves. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. Nasa weberbaueri is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or arid habitats.
